meta.name: description
meta.content: The mission of the Millard Public Schools is to guarantee each student demonstrates the character, knowledge, and skills necessary for personal excellence and responsible citizenship through an innovative, world-class education.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-alert-message field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Millard is open remotely. School buildings are closed to the public.Â Click HERE for Covid-19 information.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Millard offers 35 neighborhood schools and many programs of choice. Click here to enroll.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Want to work in a high-energy, positive place with great benefits?Â Click here forÂ current openings.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p:
Click on theÂ year you want to see:
2020-21Â | 2021-22

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: The mission of the Millard Public Schools is to guarantee each student demonstrates the character, knowledge, and skills necessary for personal excellence and responsible citizenship through an innovative, world-class educational community that engages and challenges all students.

div.div: How do Millard schools compare to other schools?

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Millard students consistently score above metro, state and national averages. We believe in high expectations and foster an Advanced Placement culture. To learn more about the district and your schools, read the Nebraska Department of Education'sÂ Nebraska Education Profile.

div.div: How can I find out which schools are assigned to my home?

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Itâs as simple as typing your address into our Millard School Assignments page. Click here and you will have your answer in seconds. If you have questions, call Student Services at 402.715.8300.

div.div: Can my child transfer to another Millard school?

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Yes, if space is available. Transfer applications must be turned in by February 15 for consideration of the upcoming school year. Click here for the Student Services transfer page.

div.div: We live outside Millard. Can my child still attend?

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Yes, as long as space is available, your child may attend through option enrollment. Option applications must be turned in by March 15 for consideration for the upcoming school year. Click here for the Student Services option page.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Absolutely and parents have many options! Eleven of our schools offer preschool for three and four year olds. All of our preschools teachers are certified with early childhood endorsements. Full and half day options are available and there are also options for scholarships. For more information, click here or call 402-715-8339.

div.div: Is before and after school child care available?

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-para-body field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Yes, the Millard Public Schools Foundation offers Kids Network, a state-certified before and after school childcare program in all 25 elementary schools. For more information, contact KidsNet at 402.991.6710.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Have questions? We have answers! Look through these questions first, and if you donât see what you are looking for, email us at mpscommunicates@mpsomaha.org.

div.div: In response to COVID-19, Millard Public School buildings are closed. The district is open remotely. You may reach us by email at mpscommunicates@mpsomaha.org and by...

div.a: Board of Education Meetings Now on Zoom

div.div: Pursuant to the Governorâs Executive Order No. 20 â 03 and for public health purposes associated with COVID-19, Board of Education meetings will be held...
This May Millard is asking voters for approval of a bond to address district building repairs and maintenance. The $125 million dollar bond would add...

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Get the FREE app to get up to date information about your child's sports information, grades, lunch menus, and Millard's social media.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: The Millard School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, marital status, disability, age, or on any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local laws in admission or access toÂ or treatment of employment, in its programs and activities. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the discrimination and harassment policies: Associate Superintendent of Human Resources, 5606 South 147 Street, Omaha, NE 68137 (402) 715-8200. The Associate Superintendent of Human Resources may delegate this responsibility as needed. Complaints by school personnel or job applicants regarding unlawful discrimination or unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) shall follow the procedures of District Rule 4001.2. Complaints by students or parents regarding unlawful discrimination or unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) shall follow the procedures of District Rule 5010.2.Â
